'''Duilin''' was an [[Elf]]-lord of [[Gondolin]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.

==History==
He was the chief of the [[folk of the Swallow]]. He was the "swiftest of all men to run and leap",<ref name=Gondolin>{{LT2|III}}</ref>{{rp|173}} and the surest of the archers of the [[Eldalië]].<ref name=Appendix>{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry "Duilin"</ref>

When the [[Fall of Gondolin]] began, [[Gothmog (balrog)|Gothmog]] led [[Melko]]'s armies to the northern gate, but the folks of the Swallow and [[House of the Heavenly Arch|of the Arch]] were in the northern walls and began pouring arrows from the there.<ref name=Gondolin />{{rp|176}} As he shot, Duilin perished falling from the battlements after being smitten by a fiery bolt of the [[Balrogs]] from outside the city.<ref name=Gondolin>{{LT2|III}}</ref>{{rp|178}}

== Etymology ==
His name means "Swallow" in [[Gnomish]]; its [[Qenya]] form was '''''Tuilindo'''''.<ref name=Appendix />
